mdRecord.dcterms:title: Bryan Hall, exterior|general view
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Graves, Michael (American architect, born 1934) [architect]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: North colonnade between two elevated primary walking terraces overlooking the amphitheater below

Bryan Hall houses the Department of English Language and Literature, offering undergraduate and graduate degrees and programs. Funded in large part by his family members, the building is named for John Stewart Bryan (Col 1893, 1895) of Richmond, publisher of the Richmond News Leader and the Richmond Times-Dispatch newspapers. Postmodern architect Michael Graves designed the building, completed in 1995. [work]
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: James Murray Howard University of Virginia Historic Buildings and Grounds Collection
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Architecture and City Planning
